00023 #ifndef _GNILND_HSS_OPS_H
00024 #define _GNILND_HSS_OPS_H
00025 
00026 #include <linux/typecheck.h>
00027 
00028 #if defined(GNILND_USE_RCA)
00029 /* for krca nid & nic translation */
00030 #include <krca_lib.h>
00031 
00032 /* it isn't exported, so just point directly to it */
00033 extern void send_hb_2_l0(void);
00034 
00035 static inline void
00036 kgnilnd_hw_hb(void)
00037 {
00038         send_hb_2_l0();
00039 }
00040 
00041 /* we use RCA types here to get the compiler to whine when we have
00042  * mismatched types */
00043 static inline int
00044 kgnilnd_nid_to_nicaddrs(rca_nid_t nid, int numnic, nic_addr_t *nicaddrs)
00045 {
00046         int     rc;
00047 
00048         /* compile time checks to ensure that the RCA types match
00049          * the LNet idea of NID and NIC */
00050         typecheck(__u32, nid);
00051         typecheck(__u32, *nicaddrs);
00052 
00053         rc = krca_nid_to_nicaddrs(nid, numnic, nicaddrs);
00054 
00055         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "RCA nid %d -> nic 0x%x, rc: %d\n",
00056                nid, nicaddrs[0], rc);
00057 
00058         RETURN(rc);
00059 }
00060 
00061 static inline int
00062 kgnilnd_nicaddr_to_nid(nic_addr_t nicaddr, rca_nid_t *nid)
00063 {
00064         /* compile time checks to ensure that the RCA types match
00065          * the LNet idea of NID and NIC */
00066         typecheck(__u32, nicaddr);
00067         typecheck(__u32, nid[0]);
00068 
00069         return krca_nicaddr_to_nid(nicaddr, nid);
00070 }
00071 
00072 static inline int
00073 kgnilnd_setup_nic_translation(__u32 device_id)
00074 {
00075         return 0;
00076 }
00077 
00078 #endif /* GNILND_USE_RCA */
00079 
00080 #endif /* _GNILND_HSS_OPS_H */
